item.title: Beogram 4002 (5501): Return of an Old Friend from Australia - Dead Solenoid Transistor and a Carriage Motor with a Corroded Lead
item.description:
Unfortunately, I recently received a well-used Beolover Beogram shipping container from Australia. Inside was a Beogram 4002 (5501) that I had previously restored in 2016. The 5501 model is unique because it represents a short-lived transitional version produced during B&O’s shift from the Beogram 4000 to the 4002. Although the 5501 features the analog control system of the 4002 series (unlike the 4000’s more sophisticated hard-wired digital logic system, which was sadly simplified in the 4002), it retains the mechanical carriage position switches found in the 4000...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-5501-return-of-an-old-friend-from-australia-dead-solenoid-transistor-and-a-carriage-motor-with-a-corroded-lead/
